findings.title: Potentially unlimited indemnification
findings.rationale: Indemnity obligations may be uncapped, which can expose you to costs far beyond the contract value.

findings.title: Confidentiality may be perpetual / indefinite
findings.rationale: Indefinite confidentiality can create long-term compliance burden and uncertainty around retention and disclosure.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...7. CONFIDENTIALITY Confidentiality obligations are perpetual and continue indefinitely, without any expiration or time limitation....

modifications or use of the Software.

6. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
Licensor's liability is unlimited for indemnification, confidentiality, and intellectual property claims, and is not subject to any cap.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY
Confidentiality obligations are perpetual and continue indefinitely, without any expiration or time limitation.

findings.title: Specific governing law or venue
findings.rationale: Governing law and venue choices can affect enforcement cost and strategy.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...11. GOVERNING LAW This Agreement is governed by California law, and the parties consent to exclusive jurisdiction in California courts....
findings.context:
10. ATTORNEYS' FEES
Licensor shall be entitled to recover all attorneys' fees, court costs, and expenses from Licensee in any action to enforce or interpret this Agreement.

11. GOVERNING LAW
This Agreement is governed by California law, and the parties consent to exclusive jurisdiction in California courts.

This Agreement is effective as of March 1, 2025.

findings.title: Late fees / high interest
findings.rationale: Penalty terms can increase costs if payment timing slips.

3. PAYMENT TERMS
Licensee shall pay annual license and maintenance fees of $80,000, due on the anniversary date. Overdue payments incur a late fee of 5% plus interest at 2% per month.

4. TERM AND TERMINATION
Licensor may terminate immediately upon Licensee's breach. Licensee requires 60 days notice to terminate.
